name: IT Disaster Recovery Plan
description: This document outlines the procedures to be followed in the event of a disaster that affects the IT infrastructure of the company.
objectives: Ensure the continuity of critical business operations in the event of a disaster.
Minimize the impact of a disaster on the company's reputation and financial stability.
Protect the company's data and information assets.
scope: This DRP applies to all IT systems and infrastructure, including servers, networks, applications, and data.

responsibilities: Coordinating the implementation and testing of the DRP.
Reviewing and updating the DRP on a regular basis.
Maintaining and updating the IT infrastructure.
Implementing and testing the DRP procedures.
Providing technical support during a disaster.
Developing and implementing business continuity plans.
Coordinating the response to a disaster.
Communicating with stakeholders during a disaster.

procedures.title: Backup and Recovery Procedures
procedures.description: This procedure outlines the steps to be taken to backup and recover data and systems in the event of a disaster.
steps: Create regular backups of critical data and systems.
Store backups in a secure location off-site.
Test the backup and recovery procedures regularly.

procedures.title: Incident Response Procedures
procedures.description: This procedure outlines the steps to be taken in the event of a disaster.
steps: Assess the situation and determine the extent of the damage.
Communicate with stakeholders about the incident.

procedures.title: Recovery Procedures
procedures.description: This procedure outlines the steps to be taken to recover from a disaster.
steps: Restore critical data and systems from backups.
Test the restored systems to ensure they are functioning properly.

evaluation_criteria: Time taken to restore critical systems
Effectiveness of communication during the test
